messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How cold does it get this Friday?

Could you tell me which location you’d like the forecast for? For example, a city name, ZIP/postal code, or latitude/longitude. Once I have that, I can let you know how cold it’s expected to get this Friday.
I don't have the location info right now.
No problem—just let me know the place you’re interested in. You can give me a city name, ZIP/postal code, or latitude/longitude coordinates, and I’ll check the forecast for this Friday.

No worries—it’s just that I need some kind of place to look up the forecast. If you can share any of the following, I’ll pull Friday’s low temperature for you:

• A city name (e.g. “Chicago”)  
• A ZIP or postal code  
• Latitude/longitude coordinates  

If you’re on a phone or computer, you can often tap the location icon in a maps app or website to grab your current coordinates. Once you have any of those, just let me know and I’ll check how cold it’s going to get this Friday.
I really can't say right now.

I understand. I’m afraid I can’t pull up a forecast without some kind of location—be it a city, ZIP/postal code, or even a general region (for example, “northern California” or “southeastern England”). 

If you’d prefer not to share specifics, you could:
• Give me a broad area (state, province, region, country)  
• Pick any nearby city or town you’re comfortable naming  
• Share approximate coordinates if you have them  

Just let me know whatever you’re okay with, and I’ll get you Friday’s low temperature.
